Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery plate; on top of rim black-figure decoration consisting of part of possible siren (wing with added red and possibly tail remaining) to left; at right, part of sphinx (tail, part of rump with red, and wing) to right; incised blob rosette as filling ornament; outside and underside of rounded rim glazed, and also band around periphery of underside; on underside, two dilute brown rays preserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd is also published in Callipolitis-Feytmans, D., Les Plats attiques à figures noires. Paris 1974, 346, no. 50.
Bibliographic references: Beazley 1944 / Groups of Early Attic Black Figure (p. 54, no. 90)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 351, no. B441)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 226, no. 7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0801) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 92, pl. I, no. 23)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
